Home → Events and activities → Lowestoft Library Literary Festival

Lowestoft Library Literary Festival 2017

Saturday 7 October, 1430-2000. Meet Ben Garrod, George Szirtes, Simon Scarrow and Libby Purves. Tickets available from Lowestoft Library: £3 per talk or £10 for all four.

Ben Garrod

1430–1530

Ben Garrod will be sharing insights into his work as a biologist, primatologist and broadcaster.

George Szirtes

1600–1700

George Szirtes will be sharing and talking about his work as a translator and award-winning poet.

Simon Scarrow

1730–1800

Simon Scarrow will be talking about his books, including the Eagles of the Empire series, set in ancient Rome.

Libby Purves

1900–2000

Libby Purves will be talking about her long career as a presenter, journalist and author.
